titleStmt.title: News from Frost-Fair upon the river of Thames : being a description of the boths, tents, accomodations, frollicks, sports and humours of those innumerable crowd's of resorters, the like never before published : to the tune of Come from the temple to the bed, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for I. Wright, I. Clark, W. Thackeray, and T. Passinger,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.

Manuscript note at head of title: This exceedingly rare ballad I believe to be unique; it has not, that I am aware of, been reprinted ... I purchased it of Mr. Andrews, books. Bristol ... [signed] George Daniel, Canenbury, October 1847.
Reproduction of original in Harvard University Library.
